movesets.name: Spikes Lead

items.name: Focus Sash
items.description: The holder always survives one attack. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Accelgor is a very good Spikes setter due to its high Speed stat, which provides very useful support to hyper offense teams. Final Gambit allows Accelgor to prevent Rapid Spin or Defog for a turn and gives a teammate a free switch-in. Final Gambit can also deal huge damage to most Defog and Rapid Spin users if Accelgor has enough HP left. Encore prevents Accelgor from becoming setup bait and might give setup opportunities to its own teammates as well. Finally, Bug Buzz is Accelgor's STAB move of choice and prevents it from being completely shut down by Taunt.

Set Details

252 Speed EVs and a Timid nature allow Accelgor to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame and quickly set hazards. 252 HP EVs give Accelgor some much needed bulk and maximize the potential power of Final Gambit. Focus Sash guarantees that Accelgor sets at least one layer of Spikes. 252 Special Attack EVs can be used instead if you want Accelgor to hit harder. Accelgor's abilities are situational, but they might come in handy for different playstyles. Sticky Hold prevents Accelgor from being crippled by Trick users, but Unburden allows Accelgor to set multiple layers of Spikes against Choice Scarf Pokemon that can bring it to 1 HP.

Usage Tips

Although this Accelgor set works best as a lead on hyper offense teams, it is not advisable to lead with it if the opponent has a Fake Out user such as Ambipom or a multi-hit move user such as Cinccino or Rhyperior, as they will limit Accelgor to one layer of Spikes. Due to its high Speed, Accelgor can Encore almost all setup Pokemon and thereby create setup opportunities for teammates. Final Gambit should be used carefully, though it is handy against opposing Defog and Rapid Spin users, especially at high HP. Golbat, Gligar, Togekiss, Hitmonlee, Hitmontop, and Kabutops are all OHKOed by Final Gambit if Accelgor is at full health. Even if it is not at high enough HP, Final Gambit allows you to bring in a check freely, while also preventing hazard removal. Final Gambit can also be used to take out a problematic Pokemon for your team.

Team Options

Ghost-types are great teammates, as they can block Rapid Spin. Doublade defeats all the relevant Rapid Spin users one-on-one. Mega Banette appreciates the Spikes support, as it can put pressure on stall teams with Taunt and Knock Off and on offensive teams with its priority attacks and Destiny Bond mind games. It can also sometimes prevent Defog with its priority Taunt. Braviary can take advantage of Defog with Defiant and proceed to deal heavy damage to the opposing team with its high-powered attacks. Cobalion and Rhyperior can set up Stealth Rock, further complementing the Spikes set up by Accelgor. Powerful attackers such as Hitmonlee, Zangoose, Clawitzer, Moltres, and Sharpedo hugely appreciate Spikes, as they force a lot of switches, and Spikes also allows them to OHKO and 2HKO many threats that they could not otherwise. They also deter the usage of Defog and Rapid Spin due to the huge offensive pressure they put on the opponent. Sharpedo gets a special mentions as it can easily clean up late-game with Spikes support, thanks to its high offenses and Speed Boost.

items.name: Focus Sash
items.description: The holder always survives one attack. One-time use.

movesets.description: This is a sample set while we are currently working on analyses in the workshop.

moves.name: Acid
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Acid Armor
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Acid Spray
moves.description: Lowers target's Special Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Agility
moves.description: Boosts Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Baton Pass
moves.description: User switches, but passes on all stat changes and some special conditions.

moves.name: Bide
moves.description: Charges for 2-3 turns; returns double the damage received in those turns.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Bug Bite
moves.description: Uses foe's Berry.

moves.name: Bug Buzz
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Curse
moves.description: Does 1/4 of max HP damage per turn at the cost of half the user's max HP if the user is a Ghost. Boosts Attack and Defense and lowers Speed by 1 stage otherwise.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Encore
moves.description: Causes the target to repeat the last move for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Feint
moves.description: Only works if the foe uses Detect or Protect; nullifies effects of those moves.

moves.name: Final Gambit
moves.description: Faints the user. Target takes damage equal to the user's HP at the time of use.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Gastro Acid
moves.description: Nullifies the foe's ability.

moves.name: Giga Drain
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Guard Split
moves.description: Averages Defense and Special Defense stats of the user with the target.

moves.name: Guard Swap
moves.description: Swaps Defense and Special Defense boosts and drops.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dark
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dragon
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Electric
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Fighting
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Fire
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Flying
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Ghost
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Grass
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Ground
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Ice
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Poison
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Psychic
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Rock
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Steel
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Water
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Infestation
moves.description: Traps and damages target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Leech Life
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt.

moves.name: Me First
moves.description: Uses the foe's attack at 1.5x power. Must be faster to work.

moves.name: Mega Drain
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt.

moves.name: Mind Reader
moves.description: The next move used will always hit.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Power Swap
moves.description: Swaps Attack and Special Attack boosts and drops with the foe.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Pursuit
moves.description: Doubles in power if the target switches, and hits them before they can escape.

moves.name: Quick Attack
moves.description: The user always attacks first.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Recover
moves.description: Heals 50% of user's max HP.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sandstorm
moves.description: Summons a sandstorm for 5 turns.

moves.name: Signal Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Spikes
moves.description: Causes damage to the enemy whenever they switch.

moves.name: Struggle Bug
moves.description: Lowers target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.description: Attacks, then switches.

moves.name: Venoshock
moves.description: Hits poisoned targets with double Base Power.

moves.name: Yawn
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep after 2 turns.

abilities.name: Sticky Hold
abilities.description: This Pokemon's item cannot be removed. Increases the chance of encountering Pokemon while fishing.

abilities.name: Unburden
abilities.description: Speed increases when an item is used or lost.
